artist: Artist: Julee Tomas , et al.; Publisher: Julee Tomas , France
creditline: Fly Zine Archive, The Mary and Robyn Campbell Fund for Art Books and gift of funds from Mary and Bob Mersky
description: Saddle stitched binding, designs and letterpress text printed in red offset lithography on transparent film cover, with xerographic photo-collage of various images and designs printed on lavender wove paper covers, visible beneath the transparent cover; 46 pp.
medium: Offset lithography and xerography; bound volume
text: Helen’s Tits is a French fanzine for the queercore punk band God Is My Co-Pilot, who Fly toured with in the 1990s, singing vocals and playing bass. The zine includes interviews, essays, poetry, and art by the band’s fans, placing the zine in a subgenre known as fanzines. Fanzines help forge networks between artists, musicians, and fans by hosting a dedicated space for sharing interviews, concert experiences, and art with fans and band members alike.
title: helen's tits
